messages.body: $TSLA " Tesla is in talks with electric truck customers to install ‚ÄòMegacharger‚Äô stations, report says" https://electrek.co/2018/02/02/tesla-semi-electric-truck-customers-megacharger-charging-station/

links.title: Tesla is in talks with electric truck customers to install 'Megacharger' stations, report says
links.description: When Tesla unveiled its all-electric truck, Tesla Semi, last year, it made several impressive claims about the vehicle's specs and capabilities - leaving us to believe that it relies on significant battery improvements. One of those impressive aspects is the 'Megacharger' technology, which Elon Musk claims could add "400 miles of range to a Tesla Semi in 30 minutes."

$TSLA Tesla is collaborating with Anheuser-Busch and United Parcel Service to build on-site charging terminals https://www.cnbc.com/2018/02/02/how-teslas-first-truck-charging-stations-will-be-built.html $AAPL

links.title: How Tesla's first truck charging stations will be built
links.description: Ramin Talaie/Bloomberg | Getty Images Elon Musk, the chief executive of Tesla, has said little about how he plans to turn his prototype electric truck into reality. But Reuters has learned that Tesla is collaborating with Anheuser-Busch and United Parcel Service to build on-site charging terminals at their facilities as part of the automaker's efforts to roll out the vehicle next year.

http://ooc.bz/l/20366

links.title: Elon Musk's Flamethrower Stunt Feels Like an ICO
links.description: This post originally appeared in Money Stuff. I haven't followed Elon Musk's flamethrower-selling stunt closely, but I gather that the gist of it is that he got some flamethrowers, peddled them on the internet for $500 each, and will use the money to fund the operations of The Boring Company, the company he started to (1) drill tunnels or something and (2) conduct hilarious pranks.

links.title: Tesla raises $546M in first asset-backed securities deal
links.description: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) today sold $546M of bonds backed by lease payments on Model X and Model S vehicles, and was able to cut interest rates on the multi-part deal from levels initially floated to investors, WSJ reports.
